trans-unit.source: When you use an integrated development environment (IDE) to build a Java application, you can launch the application from within the IDE at any point in the development process. Typically, the IDE launches a JVM dedicated to the application. When the application completes, the JVM exits. Any database connections established by the application are closed.

seg-source.mrk: When you use an integrated development environment (IDE) to build a Java application, you can launch the application from within the IDE at any point in the development process.
Typically, the IDE launches a JVM dedicated to the application.
When the application completes, the JVM exits.
Any database connections established by the application are closed.

target.mrk: When you use an integrated development environment (IDE) to build a Java application, you can launch the application from within the IDE at any point in the development process.
Typically, the IDE launches a JVM dedicated to the application.
When the application completes, the JVM exits.
Any database connections established by the application are closed.

trans-unit.source: During the development of a database application, most IDEs allow you to test individual database connections and queries without running the entire application. When you test an individual database connection or query (which requires a database connection), the IDE might launch a JVM that runs in a specialized testing environment. In this case, when a test completes, the JVM remains active and available for further testing, and the database connection established during the test remains open.

seg-source.mrk: During the development of a database application, most IDEs allow you to test individual database connections and queries without running the entire application.
When you test an individual database connection or query (which requires a database connection), the IDE might launch a JVM that runs in a specialized testing environment.
In this case, when a test completes, the JVM remains active and available for further testing, and the database connection established during the test remains open.

target.mrk: During the development of a database application, most IDEs allow you to test individual database connections and queries without running the entire application.
When you test an individual database connection or query (which requires a database connection), the IDE might launch a JVM that runs in a specialized testing environment.
In this case, when a test completes, the JVM remains active and available for further testing, and the database connection established during the test remains open.

trans-unit.source: Because of the behaviors of the IDE described above, if you use the embedded <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> JDBC driver, you may encounter errors connecting in the following situations:

seg-source.mrk: Because of the behaviors of the IDE described above, if you use the embedded <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> JDBC driver, you may encounter errors connecting in the following situations:

target.mrk: Because of the behaviors of the IDE described above, if you use the embedded <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> JDBC driver, you may encounter errors connecting in the following situations:

trans-unit.source: You test an individual query or database connection and then try to run an application that uses the same database as the tested feature.

seg-source.mrk: You test an individual query or database connection and then try to run an application that uses the same database as the tested feature.

target.mrk: You test an individual query or database connection and then try to run an application that uses the same database as the tested feature.

trans-unit.source: The database connection established by testing the connection or query stays open, and prevents the application from establishing a connection to the same database.

seg-source.mrk: The database connection established by testing the connection or query stays open, and prevents the application from establishing a connection to the same database.

target.mrk: The database connection established by testing the connection or query stays open, and prevents the application from establishing a connection to the same database.

trans-unit.source: You run an application, and before it completes (for example, while it waits for user input), you attempt to run a second application or to test a connection or query that uses the same database as the first application.

seg-source.mrk: You run an application, and before it completes (for example, while it waits for user input), you attempt to run a second application or to test a connection or query that uses the same database as the first application.

target.mrk: You run an application, and before it completes (for example, while it waits for user input), you attempt to run a second application or to test a connection or query that uses the same database as the first application.
